Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Corporal ornament
Description: Fragment of a necklace comprised of sixteen rectangular mother-of-pearl plates, pierced at both ends. They can be strung by themselves, like in this example, or inter-spaced with faience beads or oyster shells. This is a characteristic feature of the C-group culture.
